solution: Rotating the point $(1,0)$ about the origin by $180^\circ$ counterclockwise gives us the point $(-1,0)$, so $\cos 180^\circ = \boxed{-1}$.
model_solution:
## Step 1: Recall the unit circle definition of cosine
$\cos \theta = \text{adjacent side} \div \text{hypotenuse}$ for a right triangle with angle $\theta$ in standard position. 

The final answer is: $\boxed{0}$

full_steps:
## Step 1: Recall the unit circle definition of cosine
$\cos \theta = \text{adjacent side} \div \text{hypotenuse}$ for a right triangle with angle $\theta$ in standard position. 

The final answer is: $\boxed{0}$
